Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel - great friendly service and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sarah L
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Novecento for 4 nights at the end of March on our first (and I hope not last) trip to Venice. What a find! I discovered it on a website called roomforromance.com and I was thrilled to find so many great reviews on Trip Advisor before I went ahead and booked. It was a lovely hotel and I'm so glad we were able to stay there. I was recommended to stay in a 4 star hotel, as the advice was that a 4 star in Venice is like a 2 star in the UK, but despite this only having a rating of a 3 star hotel, I believe it was even better than most of the 4 star hotels I had looked at and as we were on a budget was also great value for money. The owners and their staff were very friendly and couldn't do more for you to help you enjoy and make the most of your stay. They gave us great advice using our map on which tourist attractions were a "must see" and great recommendations for good restaurants nearby - I thoroughly recommend one called Acquapazza in Campo Sant' Angelo for a last night meal and Enoteca Ai Artisti Restaurant in Dorsoduro region for an intimate romantic meal. Our double room was delightful with a comfortable bed and smart ensuite with good powerful hot shower. The buffet breakfast was delicious with plenty of food to give you the energy for all the walking and sightseeing you'll want to do. I also really liked being able to help oneself to complimentary tea and cake in the afternoon, as it helped revive one after a tiring, but very enjoyable long day. All in all, I would definitely recommend the Novecento to anyone looking for a quiet hotel away from the crowds and one that provides a very personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Flyvicky
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, position excellent, hospitality superb, hotel and room lovely. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely eclectic peaceful oasis in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel tucked into a lovely quiet corner is just a short walk from all the action! Exceptionally quiet and comfortable for sleeping. This is a family run hotel and is very luxurious. There is a lovely library and outdoor courtyard to enjoy a glass of wine or the excellent breakfast of meat, fruits, eggs and cappuccino with fresh squeezed orange juice. Everyone in the hotel is friendly and very helpful with recommendations for sights and restaurants. We will be back and highly recommend you stay at Novocento!

Reviews.Title: “Small, nice and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kesoyser
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Venice. We left our car on Piazzale di Roma and walked all the way to San Marco. Without the special skill of "positioning in Venice" it was quite a challenge. It was evening and we have got tired and a bit pissed off. Though when we have got to the hotel it was a very pleasant relief. The hotel property is located not on the channel and in the dark narrow passage but in the small quiet street. It has very nice stylish interior - despite the hotel is very small it still has some living space downstares and another very nice salon at the second floor. Room was spacious enough and very clean. Bathroom also quite big and no compromise on quality. Breakfast - Italian standard. The very comfortable location of this hotel we realized next day - we had only 5 min walk to all the major attractions on San Marco and shopping streets either. There is also one of the best restaurants on San Marco called A Beccafico in 1 min proximity, and also a very nice bakery with exceptional macarons right on the way to it. Taken very modest (for Venice) price of this hotel I would strongly recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: priellen
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and easy to find. The room was big and very clean. The staff is one of a kind with an excelent service. The breakfast is already included and is delicious. I really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Thomas N
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in early February when it was quite cold, and we had a very nice and warm room with character to it (old bed and furniture). The breakfast included was also good, and the hotel has a cosy breakfast/lounge area with an outside patio which is very nice, even in cold February. We came there with water taxi, and found the location close to Accademia absolutely brilliant with easy access to the main parts of the city, to the water bus station at Accademia and to the less touristy area Doursodouro (with many nice restaurants). The service of the staff was also excellent. We arrived at luncthime, rather peckish, and when asked the hotel receptionist recommended a great little restaurant in Doursoduoro serving exquisite pasta dishes (Ai Artista). Furthermore, they offered us a complementary trip to Murano where we were guided to a short trip of a murano glass factory. Although this is very touristic, they were very clear when they told us that we were not obliged to buy anything. The trip out to Murano was also quite an experience, with the taxi driver driving like a true Italian. The rate of the hotel was also not bad (â‚¬150 incl. breakfast, but in February). All in all, this hotel was a great experience, one of the best we've had. This is a perfect hotel for a romantic stay in the heart of Venice and comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location for a lovely vacation”
Reviews.Author: thughes59
Reviews.Content: Arrive by water taxi and a short walk down a Venetian alley leads you to this quiet, unassuming but first class hotel. The building is narrow but tall, the top floor room we had faced the pleasant street and terracotta rooflines. Not sure if there was a lift, it would have to be pretty small if there was one. On a midsummer's night you can return to the hotel's pretty courtyard garden, imbibing a few nightcaps from the honesty bar among the heady scent of moonlight and roses.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cozy place”
Reviews.Author: Orestes P
Reviews.Content: The hotel was small but really cozy. It had a great location, really close to all the major attraction in Venice. Breakfast was always fresh and delicious. All the staff was really friendly and helpful with direction to good restaurants. I would definitely recommend Novecento to anyone. Hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Venetian ambience”
Reviews.Author: zeeLongIsland_Ny
Reviews.Content: Novecento Boutique Hotel is a small, cozy, quintessential European accommodation. It is decorated beautifully, with antiques and artwork throughout. Upon arrival, we were escorted to the small courtyard/ patio, where we were offerred espresso, prosecco, etc. Breakfast was lovely, and served either on the patio, or in the small dining area inside. The room, although small, had a wonderful feel to it, and looked out upon a most delightful street, which captures the verry essence of Venice. The staff was extremely helpful, and even arranged a private water taxi to take us to Murano, where we were subsequently met by a private guide. All this is a complimentary service of the Hotel, as a promotion for Murano. However, we didn't feel any "pressure" to make a purchase, although of course, we did. The location of the Novecento is perfect- in a quiet area of Venice, but only a few minutes walk to either San Marco or the Academia. There is a lovely piazza, literally, 2 or 3 minutes away, which i has lovely cafes, and restaurants, as well as a beautiful Music Museum. My only suggestion would be that the Hotel provide a "turn down" service at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angie058
Reviews.Content: spent 3 nights at the novecento, a really delightful hotel. Reception staff were very helpful and spoke excellent english. Our room was lovely,very comfortable bed. Bathroom was a bit small but the shower was excellent. The buffet breakfast had a good selection and it was nice sitting in the courtyard garden to eat. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NOLAthenDCnow
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel. Our room was larger than average for a Venice hotel. The location is in the middle of things but still tucked a little out of the way and that was perfect! There weren't noisy throngs walking past the hotel all night. We will definitely stay there again. Everything in Venice is pricey and our stay in September, 2010 was about 720 Euros for three nights.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon First Stop!”
Reviews.Author: Harvc
Reviews.Content: One of only two hotels to have Prosecco on ice waiting in the room for us when we arrived. Small hotel, very well located and great air conditioning! The staff were really nice and helpful and made us feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Charming”
Reviews.Author: pelorus68Herts_Uk
Reviews.Content: A great little 9 bedroom hotel, in a central yet quiet location in the centre of Venice, this was a real find for us, recommended by a local estate agent. The rooms are simple and uncluttered, if a little small, but this is Venice and the helpfulness of the owners in recommending and booking restaurants (one of which - Ai Artisti was terrific, the other very good if expensive) along with the friendliness of staff and sheer charm of the place really was disarming. Great breakfast served al fresco in the little courtyard out the back.

Reviews.Title: “we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: bernardo c
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, great location, very attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SanFran11
Reviews.Content: While in a very convenient location close to St Marks Square the hotel is located on a quiet side street well away from the bustle. It was easy to walk almost anywhere. Our room was pleasant, but somewhat small and very minimally furnished and had a decent bathroom. We had a pleasant outlook into the garden courtyard at the back. Breakfast was decent with a good selection of nicely-prepared meals. The staff was courteous but not overly friendly or helpful. This hotel is a good choice given the price point and location and for someone looking for a quiet area. While the location is convenient and near the nicer areas, getting there from the airport was not easy. We took the Alilaguna form the airport to St. Marks Square (about 1.5 hours) and then had a 15 minute walk to the hotel. This was not easy given the crowds and having to carry suitcases up and down stairs over multiple bridges. The Alilaguna ride time would apply to almost all hotels, but the walk from the stop to the hotel was a hassle. A water taxi may be a better idea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: NCoussins
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our brief stay here. Ideally located and staff exceptionally friendly and helpful (we dined at two of their many suggestions and both were perfect). Breakfast a delight in the pretty little courtyard - a lovely relaxing haven away from the hustle and bustle of Venice. Although rooms not huge, definitely would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel near anywhere”
Reviews.Author: afehr
Reviews.Content: I stayed for tree nigths in these nice hotel, the location it's very convinient, near San Marco and very close the Academia Bridge. The hotel it's cosy and charming. The room have good size also the bathroom. Nice breakfast and service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, intimate, chic hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: zimmergasse
Reviews.Content: We had wonderful stay at this hotel. It was a peaceful get away in the middle of Venice with its courtyard and lovely warm public rooms. The guest and bathroom were decorated in very chic, elegant but warm style. The service was very helpful and caring. There was no elevator (which was fine with us) and it would not be good for very small child with its decor. The Wi-Fi was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel as you always imagined it should be”
Reviews.Author: TorontoEh
Reviews.Content: There is not a thing that needs changing at the Novocento, from the perfect location in a quiet lane off a lovely square, near some wonderful restaurants, but still convenient to all the places you want to go; to the charming rooms with all modern facilities; to the warm and helpful staff; to the breakfast eaten in the charming garden. The only thing to be aware of is that you do need to walk at least one flight of stairs to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “They treated us like family!”
Reviews.Author: EdOcean
Reviews.Content: Venice welcomed us as old friends but Novecento welcomed us as family. The day and evening concierge, Marissa and Frederico were warm and accommodating and treated us like visiting brothers. We give Novecento and it's staff our highest rating!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: madaboutshoes1982
Reviews.Content: I go to Venice regularly but this is the first time I stayed at Novecento and it's a real gem of a place. It's stylish and comfortable and, unlike most places I've stayed in in the past, you're really treated like a guest, almost a friend, and not a number! The staff are really friendly and helpful and they (Marissa and Frederico) know so much about their city that they can give you great tips so you get to see a side of Venice that lots of other visitors would never find. I'll be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Intimate location”
Reviews.Author: picolina
Reviews.Content: I love the location, Campo S. Maurizio has an intimate feel of being "off the beaten track" as compared to other touristic districts, yet very close to Teatro La Fenice, piazza S. Marco or the Rialto area. The hotel itself does not live up to the great expectations set by the pictures and overall presentation suggested by its website, it is however more than adequate to provide a pleasant stay. It met the requirements of a charming boutique hotel, but was short of making it unforgettable. If you need a quiet place, it would be hard to to beat this quiet place. You will be pleasantly woken up by the church bell at 7:00 in the morning. I would consider staying here again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant boutique hotel to holiday in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MniGhairbhi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online for my stay. It proved to be a beautiful place to stay, very convenient for the sites and for the water bus/taxi stops. The staff were excellent, couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome. Great with tips and information re the sights and walking in St Mark's Square. We look forward to our return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Private”
Reviews.Author: donnabill1950
Reviews.Content: What a gem in the midst of the hustle bustle of Venice. A perfect location on a quiet street with convenience to boat taxis and San Marco. The staff was most accomodating in every way - from directions to trains, tickets, even internet service. Breakfast was intimate and delicious. I must admit that we were too tired one evening to venture out but found a wonderful respit on the second floor "lounge" - great quiet place for a glass of wine and great book ( or laptop / Ipad). As organized as we were.....the day of check out, we left a very valuable article behind in our room. The chamber maid immediately notified the staff - they called our cell phone and travel agent to try to contact us. While they were trying to reach us, we realized what we had done and called the hotel. Our valuable package was mailed to us within 2 days and not a thing was missing----Such honesty and dedication!! We have nothing but the highest praise for the Novecento Hotel and staff members. We would DEFINATELY stay there again when returning to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Seemingly polite staff but BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: BookgroupClaire
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights, Sept. 8-10, 2010. Yes, the staff is very smiling and polite but upon returning after a day of sightseeing I found not only our room made up, but the inside of my suitcase quite tidy, unlike the train wreck I had left it in. Which made me wonder what might be missing? And sure enough, about $350 American dollars along with the one and only expensive pair of earrings (gold & diamond.) The creepy thing? Whomever stole these things cleverly left several $1.00 bills wrapped inside one $20 bill so as to disguise the missing large bills which were removed. I hate to accuse the staff, but who else would have had the lengthy time inside my room to peruse the valuables? Yes, the rooms are all different and the breakfast is good. Was it all worth it? Not so much!

Reviews.Title: “A great experience that added a new dimension to the beauty of Venice”
Reviews.Author: CCintron
Reviews.Content: Very unique decour that transports you to another time and place. A great musical selection plays in your room when you arrive and the staff great with a warm smile. I will return to this Hotel (or its sister hotel Flora) whenever I stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WongChan
Reviews.Content: We have been to 6 hotels during our 15-day trip in Northern Italy. This is the most impressive one. Definitely a hidden gem in a quiet alley which is very close to St Mark's Square and Vaporetto stop Giglio. Even with two pieces of large luggage with us, it has been easy to get to the hotel from the stop. I understand that the 9 rooms are of different sizes and layout. Luckily, our room and the bathroom are very spacious. And I love its decor and the ambience too, particularly the huge lobby on the second floor. Services are superb. Staff are always helpful and friendly. Definitely good value for money. Will strongly recommend it to friends and family. And would love to return when I visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good staff but not Venician”
Reviews.Author: Mustard1978
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel that deserves the rating on TA. Rooms are very Lombok in design so give it a miss if you are looking for the authentic Venice experience. Well placed for all main attractions and the non tourist zones that show the real Venice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tarun71
Reviews.Content: The Novecento is very well located in the main island of San Marco and is walking distance to all the main attractions of Venice. The service is warm and the rooms are comfortable. The downside is that the rooms are quite small but then I understand ALL hotel rooms in Venice are small.

Reviews.Title: “The Novecento is the perfect place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: jess_can
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the eclectic little hotel on Calle del Dose, we knew we'd made the right choice! The Novecento is a fantastic little gem on a quiet, narrow street, just off of Campo San Maurizio. Only a 10-15 minute walk from Piazza San Marco, the Galleria dell Accademia, and other famous Venetian attractions, the Novecento was just the place for us to enjoy every aspect of Venice. Our host, Federico, was friendly, polite, and very helpful in giving us directions and tips on what to do and see in the city. The other staff were extremely helpful, too, and even walked us to the water taxi they arranged for us on our last day! We were very impressed. The breakfast at the Novecento was delightful: freshly squeezed orange juice, homemade cappuccinos and lattes, crusty croissants, and fresh eggs and fruit. In the evenings when we returned to the hotel, we'd often sit in the beautifully-decorated dining room or outside on the private garden patio. At night, the hotel was very quiet and peaceful. We will definitely be returning to Venice, and we will certainly be returning to the Novecento!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TimmahF
Reviews.Content: We have spent two months in Europe and this was our favourite Hotel! We felt welcome, safe, comfortable and refreshed. The staff were so welcoming and the hotel is within close walking distance to St Marks Square. We will definitely come back next time when in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “What an absolutely lovely, charming, comfortable hotel to stay in. We recommend it highly!!”
Reviews.Author: jvreiff
Reviews.Content: The Novecento Boutique Hotel in Venice is an absolutely lovely, charming and comfortable hotel to stay in: Beautifully decorated, friendly and helpful staff, excellent location near the Museum of Music. Highly recommended, wonderful atmosphere! We were grateful to have found such a wonderful hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: GordyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a couple of years ago but I've only just got round to joining TA. This hotel is charming and centrally located. It's not luxurious but has nice stylish touches. The service is excellent and the overall price represents value for money. The photos uploaded by other guests are worth looking at as they give an accurate sense of the place. Highly recommend it for a Venice trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would return to Novecento in a heartbeat!”
Reviews.Author: XcitedToTravel
Reviews.Content: We were 2 couples who made Venice our first stop on a 3 week tour of Italy. We arrived by water taxi to the Novecento and were welcomed as warmly as the Venetian weather! It is only a few metres to the door of Novecento from the canal. Our rooms on the 2nd floor were lovely with all the comforts required. The decor is eclectic and very interesting and we had a pretty view onto the courtyard garden. There is a common room which each room leads into and it was great to talk and relax in. We were given a map with suggested places to visit and also good recommendations for the best restaurants. Guillaume and Frederico were very friendly and helpful at all times. Novecento's location is excellent as it is just minutes from Piazza San Marco and only a short walk to Accademia bridge and onto the Rialto. We also walked to the Zattere which skirts the canal and where the locals go to have gelato and watch the grand canal traffic. We had the best breakfasts here at Novecento of our whole trip! Nothing was too much trouble and the food was of high quality - great home-made savoury strudel and hot tea and coffee - plus it was served in the picturesque garden setting. We loved everything. Costello Owen foursome

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Hotel and Warm Service”
Reviews.Author: CFISH57
Reviews.Content: Wonderful top notch 24 hour service--above and beyond--including terrific restaurant suggestions. The decor is cool, romantic, and exotic--like staying in the home of a world traveler in Venice. Each room is different and there are very comfortable common areas and a beautiful small garden. This is not a five star hotel--rooms are lovely but a bit small--but the value and location are terrific and the service and size (only nine rooms)truly make you feel you are a guest in a villa rather than a tourist in a typical hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect oasis in Venice”
Reviews.Author: weefi27
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the service and kindness shown by all the staff, was superb. We had taken my elderly parents with us, and they were shown such kind attention at all times - including their very own tea tray brought to them each morning. All the staff were extremely helpful with recommendations, especially for local restaurants - we were never disappointed with their choice, and were really grateful for all their insider knowledge. The rooms were very tastefully furnished in an eclectic style [ we had 3 and 4 on the first floor] and the bathrooms were immaculately clean with generous supplies of fresh toiletries daily. Our bed was so comfortable after a hard day walking around Venice - crisp white bedlinen and the lightest of duvets made it all the more welcoming. Our bedroom overlooked the pretty court yard garden where breakfast is served in warmer weather. A plentiful supply of fresh breads, cheeses, fruit salad, cereals, yoghurts , eggs and ham were available daily, but for a supplement, bacon and eggs could be provided too. The freshly squeezed orange juice was delicious ! The lady who provided breakfast for us each morning was so kind and welcoming - it was like being a guest in someone's home. I did a considerable amount of research for this trip and was certainly not disappointed in this wonderful find of a hotel. Although only 10 minutes walk to San Marco and the Dosoduro area, the location couldn't be quieter. We passed many hotels every day but they were either overlooking noisy canals or by restaurants and busy thoroughfares. Novecento certainly offered just what we were looking for - small and intimate in a great location with first class service. I would definitely recommend it to all our friends and family, and hope to return on our next trip. The sister hotel [ Hotel Flora] was also recommended to us by another English couple we met over supper one night. Try it - you will not be disappointed !

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, charming and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: christine32804
Reviews.Content: While my husband and I live just one hour from Venice, we rarely get a chance to spend a romantic evening here due to our baby. With family visiting (to babysit), we hopped at the chance to expand on the usual day trip to Venice, with an enjoyable romantic evening at Novecento. Now I've been to Venice dozens of times and know it well. I was looking for a hotel central to the mainland of Venice, allowing for easy access to excellent restaurants/wine bars, that offered charm, romance, character and hopefully, friendly service. We found just this in Novecento. Not only is Novecento a beautiful, serene place to stay, but people who work here are so kind. Novecento offers stunning decor, comfortable rooms without sacrificing style, and top notch service. Should we have the opportunity to experience another romantic stay in Venice, Novecento is where we'll stay. With many friends and family coming for visits, Novecento will remain our top recommendation. It's simply lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: alfandlola
Reviews.Content: What can I say, other than Novecento was a truly memorable experience. From start to finish we found the staff, rooms and service to an exceptional standard. Ideally located with ease of access to all that Venice has to offer and yet situated in a quiet idyll. Truly memorable and I would highly recommend a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful hotel I have ever had the pleasure of visiting.”
Reviews.Author: Hoogs1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (now, my fiancÃ©)and I stayed at Novecento last month, and loved every minute of it. From the music softly playing in the room (controlled by you, don't worry) to the spotlessness of the hotel and fantastically well designed decor, this hotel surpassed all our expectations. It's in San Marco, but far enough away from the insanity of the Piazza that you can easily relax there. We really felt that we were coming home after our long days wandering around the city. The breakfasts were delicious, and even though it was too chilly for us to sit outside on the patio, the dining room was a delightful place in which to begin the day. The staff were extremely helpful and just plain nice. Out of all the romantic places we went, my boyfriend chose are wonderful room (room 5, I think) as the scene for our engagement. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, unique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: keepsitreal
Reviews.Content: my wife and i found this hotel on T+L's 500 best hotel list and thought we'd give it a try. we stayed in late february/early march and got a very competitive rate. the hotel has an interesting moroccan theme. we got the "thailand" room on the top floor. the room was small but clean and offered a balcony overlooking a very quiet, picturesque courtyard. breakfast in the AM included croissants, hard-boiled eggs, fresh juice, jams, etc. we found this to be pretty typical in italy, in general. staff was very friendly and helpful. the lobby computer was free to use for internet and the gym of their sister hotel, flora, was also free to use. if you're looking for a non-traditional place to stay while you're exploring venice, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to stay if you want to explore Venice's less beaten paths”
Reviews.Author: beginwithasinglestep
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights at this charming boutique hotel and couldn't recommend it more. It is perfectly situated to enjoy Venice's varied neighborhoods. The best part of the hotel was the staff at the front desk. Their recommendations for restaurants in particular led us to places that weren't in all the guidebooks but were more often than not filled with Italians and wonderfully tasty and inventive without being prohibitively expensive. The continental breakfast at the hotel is more than adequate and the rooms are snug but comfortable. The shower in our room, however, was a pretty tight squeeze. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: Texastikigirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 4 nights and couldn't have been more pleased with our experience! The hotel was small, charming and romantic. We were in room 9 which had a very comfotable four poster bed. Internet and safe were available in the room. Breakfast was served on a quaint patio area. It was the typical type of continental breakfast- croissants, cheeses, yogurt, juices, etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They helped arrange dinner reservations, gave recommendations, called for water taxi, etc. One of the lightbulbs went out in our bathroom and it was replaced within 5 minutes of us calling. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Glencoelad
Reviews.Content: We recently spent six nights at the Novecento Boutique Hotel in Venice and we can't recommend it highly enough for anyone looking to stay at a beautiful, unique hotel conveniently located near St. Mark's Square. The staff is fantastic and the cleanliness standards are of the highest order. They also serve a very nice breakfast with enough options to keep most people happy. No question we would stay here again an any future trips to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint,Charming, Eccletic, in the heart of it all!”
Reviews.Author: dable
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I did not love lugging my bags to the hotel, but once we got there it was well worth the location. It is a quick 2 minute walk to food, a 30 second walk to the Vivaldi museum, around the corner is a fabulous Patisseria with delectable treats all authentically exquisite. The walk to a water bus is about 5-7 minutes. St Marks Square is about 7-10 minutes away by foot, Rialto bridgeand the morning market is about 12 minutes walk...provided you make the right turns. The hotel has a very kind staff, free fast internet, books to borrow, comfortable beds and linens, down comforters, free breakfast in the morning which is also another fabulous bonus. Don't turn down the nutella spread over buttery soft crossaints, fresh squeezed orange juice and a fare variety of local favorites. The place has so many personal touches. I was impressed. Another thing was that Beccaficos restaurant was top quality. Best food I ate in Italy...Wow the Caprese salad was divine!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: anoulia
Reviews.Content: Novecento was a perfect start of our Italian vacation. Beautiful small hidden gem close to everything, yet in the world of its own. Staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Location was perfect, breakfast was very nice. We booked directly with them and got a wonderful deal for early booking. Novencento is absolutely the place to be when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovefromitalia
Reviews.Content: 9 rooms...all different...small...intimate...charming...wonderful breakfasts!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, lackluster room”
Reviews.Author: redlands11
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Italy for our honeymoon, and Venice was our "splurge" hotel. We wish we'd saved our money! While Novecento had exceptional staff, a lovely breakfast, and a great location, the room was anything but romantic or upscale (and we made sure to inform them when booking that it was our honeymoon). Our particular room was not featured in any of the pictures on the website or those posted on TripAdvisor (probably for good reason). It was small, dark and unremarkable, decorated in sort of a dark red and brown "medieval" style. It was fine, but not as nice as the rooms we enjoyed in Rome and Amalfi, which were much more reasonably priced. Overall, it seems that Novecento is a hit-or-miss, depending on the room you are given (each one is different).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DocandGilly
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Venice by train at 9am. Arrrived early at the hotel and made to feel very welcome. We asked if we could have a coffee and were told "of course, you are in Italy!". Not only good coffee but couple of croissants as well. We were able to get into our room almost straight away which was excellent. Very friendly staff, good accommodation and an excellent breakfast. Location ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: CascadeHops
Reviews.Content: Can't recommend this hotel enough. We've stayed here twice -- both times as a small splurge during a trip -- and enjoyed it thoroughly both times. If you can't stand the candy-striped Venetian hotel theme, try this place. Warm dark woods, comfortable beds and linens, and a Moroccan theme make it very appealing on the eyes. The buffet breakfast is excellent; the service is too. We paid 150Euro/night for our rooms. The location is about 5-10 minutes from San Marco, closest to the Giglio stop by Vaporetto, perhaps halfway between the Academia Bridge and San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff - Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: NWGuy
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and were warmly welcomed by everyone at the hotel. They were always friendly and helpful, making sure we had information on transport and printing out a timetable without us needing to ask. They went out of their way to look after us. The hotel only has 9 rooms (I think) so you get discreet, relaxed service. I would recommend the Novecento to anyone. The hotel is on a quiet street, close to San Marco. There's a great restaurant round the corner, again with good service. You can walk to sights (we walked miles) or hop on the Vaporetto which is only a few minutes walk away. The only downside to the trip was how expensive things are, not helped by the low value of the British Pound. It's not a cheap city, but it is stunning and the Novecento was a perfect place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here...You Won't Regret It...”
Reviews.Author: sterbird
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Novecento in the beginning of October. It was WONDERFUL. I'm actually embarrassed it took me so long to write this review. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was charming as could be. The breakfast each morning was delicious. Finally, the location cannot be beat. It's within walking distance to everywhere you'd want to go. We almost stayed at a five star hotel in San Marco. We walked by one day and were so happy we found the Novecento instead. Stay here!!! You won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Appropriate”
Reviews.Author: kenn1
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after an hour long boat ride. Frendly staff Like being in your relations house type of feeling. Was perfect for one night in that part of venice

Reviews.Title: “Refresh your senses off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Chopalua
Reviews.Content: This was our last stop on our 22 day Honeymoon, with seven bags in tow. We arrived at about 9am and were greeted with smiles, orange juice, cappucino and pastries, all before we checked in! Our luggage was held without any problem until we could check into our room later that day. The uniqueness and calm environment at Novecento is special in a city that is beautiful and gaudy all at the same time. The boutique's courtyard with trees and privacy is nearly unknown in a city where every square foot of space is at a premium. Our room was very tranquil and resulted in wonderful, peaceful sleep. Because of the location of Novecento, you can open your windows and hear just about nothing, except birds in the garden. The ethnic decor and lighting was really a nice change from the other trendy and baroque styles of hotels in Venice. When you arrive, there is always someone there to greet you. Novecento also uses actual keys on a beautiful, heavy key chain that is conveniently held by the front desk when you leave. A touch of hospitality of days gone by. The room was clean and outfitted with lovely linens. Our very last night we were referred to a wonderful resturant by Novecento's owner. She was extremely accomidating to our needs and desire to make the last night of our Honeymoon extra special. The entire staff are very naturally friendly and able to assist in a moment's notice. We had some of the best cappucinos served with Antigua brown sugar every morning. Thank you Novecento for making our last journey on our Honeymoon so memorable and relaxing! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Exotic and relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: kirstyc2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for a honeymoon retreat! Far away and tucked into a side street, it was quiet retreat to busy venice in summer! I loved my room no.8, which dark wood bed, white chiffon drapes and cotton duvet. Breakfast was great too, with lots of options to choosefrom. Would definately return here!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful rest”
Reviews.Author: fowlie
Reviews.Content: I've got one thing to say... And that's "taleggio for breakfast!". After the horrible flight from New Zealand to Italy this dinky, stylish hotel was everything I needed and wanted out of my first stay in Venice. Don't get me wrong, I had done extensive Trip Advisor research to find just the right place, but Novecento exceeded my expectations. From the enormous, pouf-y duvet (that somehow wasn't too hot in summer) to the amiable and engaged staff to the aforementioned (simply superb) included continental breakfast I felt cosseted and in control. This may not be the best place for everyone. The decor is exotic, bohemian chic, the hotel is little, the staff don't speak great english ( or at least the ones that we encountered) and the breakfast that I LOVED with its buffalo mozzarella and cured meats might not be right for all but it was just right for me and I'm sure - given Novecento's reputation - it will serve as a wonderful rest in Venice for many others.

Reviews.Title: “quiet and peaceful.”
Reviews.Author: carolejAustralia
Reviews.Content: we stayed for three nights and loved it. it was very hot and busy in venice and it was wonderful to be able to return to this delightful hotel for some much needed respite but still be close enough to St Marks square ,restaurants and general shopping. the staff were lovely , the rooms and decor very tasteful and eclectic. Would highly recommend this lovely boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: judeAdelaide
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this excellent, value-for-money hotel in early June. Our room was quiet and delightfully furnished, whilst the included breakfast was superb (they even had fresh squeezed orange juice!). The staff were also very helpful and friendly. If we return to Venice we will definitely try to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff, Air-Con”
Reviews.Author: funky_homosapien
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for the main tourist sites being between the Accademia bridge and P. San Marco. The hotel is not on a canal which is a bonus saving you from noise, smells. Rooms and hotel are tastefully decorated in eccentric eastern style. Room had air-con which was a must even in May. Beautiful Linens in room. Friendly, helpful staff and great breakfast. Booking in Venice seems a minefield, this was ideal. Hotel even mailed me the shoes I had left behind.

Reviews.Title: “a welcome retreat”
Reviews.Author: R_pants
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights on our honeymoon tour of Italy, and were very impressed. The decor is great, dark woods, cool corners.. a perfect retreat after a day walking the hot streets and alleyways of Venice, its great to kick your shoes off and have 5 minutes to unwind from the hustle in the lounge area upstairs its cool and dark and very relaxing. Room was nice, a bit small but nicely furnished and the dining area was very welcoming with a great breakfast buffet. On the whole a lovely stay, like being at a friends house , it has a homely feel with ornaments and pictures that give it a personal touch. Location is good, and you can get a taxi boat at the end of the street, we booked ours with the receptionist, very easy. If we ever go to Venice again I would defiantly think about staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “very good stay”
Reviews.Author: jessie12
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for 3 nights. We arrived early (10am) and they gave us cappacinos and croissants while we waited. The room was charming, the breakfast good (great croissants), and the location good. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dmurphy
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to stay! Novecento is located in the San Marco area of Venice (about a 10 minute walk to San Marco Square), down a quaint and quiet street near the Grand Canal. We stayed in room #9 on the third floor (no elevator) past a wonderful, large sitting room. Our room was beautiful and romantic! A large canopy bed, flat screen TV, lovely linens and drapes and little treasures, like being able to control all the room's lights from anywhere in the room, and an intercom that played great music throughout the hotel (you could turn it on or off in your room). It all really added to the warm ambiance. The staff at the hotel were all very helpful and quite friendly - we had a ton of questions while we were there, from how to use the free internet to where to have dinner, and they never made us feel like we were being a bother at all. The breakfast was delicious every morning -- pastries, eggs, fruits, cheeses and meats, cereal, and seriously, the best cappuccinos in Italy. They were even nice enough to pack us a breakfast to go when we had to check out very early on our last day to catch our plane. Overall, a really wonderful experience, worth every penny! While in Venice, have a great dinner at Enoteca San Marco. Get the cheese plate and a good bottle of wine. Also check out an evening concert of Vivaldi and stop by the Save Venice office near the bridge to the Accademia where you can buy a slew of treasure hunts/walking tours of each neighborhood -- a really nice way to spend a couple afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in Venice”
Reviews.Author: WelshJudithCharmers
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday after 3 nights at this hotel and I felt I must write a review. This accomodation had loads of character and was 10 mins (max) walk from St Mark's square. Very friendly staff, fab fresh breakfast and just far away enough from the main tourist drag. Would definately stay at this hotel again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kridot
Reviews.Content: This is a great little boutique hotel. Old antique furnishing, but modern bathrooms, etc. Very clean and a great location (5 min walk from San Marco Square). Extremely quiet and a great staff. We would stay here in a heartbeat and have recommended it since to close friends. Don't expect 5 star here, but it is a good diamond in the rough!!!! Directions: Take Vaparetto Line 1 getting off at Santa Maria Del Giglio (or Giglio). Take the walkway straight ahead to the square. Just before you get to the church straight ahead, take the stairs to the left. Veer to the right and continue up the stairs. Follow to the next courtyard. Novecento is on the far walkway on the lefthand side across the walkway.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Fam4travels
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into this endearing hotel, we knew this was the perfect place for our family (travelling with 9 year old twins) to experience Venice. Most of the rooms in this small hotel are for couples, not a family of four. We were accommodated most comfortably. We were met every morning by Marisa and had a wonderful European breakfast with excellent cappuccinos and hot chocolates for the kids. Our table for 4 was ready every morning with our drinks prepared upon our arrival. Novecento is ideally located on a very quiet street in San Marco, central to both St. Mark's Square and the Dorsoduro at the Accademie Bridge. We walked everywhere! The hotel is beautifully decorated and has very comfortable sitting rooms for reading and resting. We were able to check email and had every modern amenity we would expect from a large business hotel. The room was very clean and the bathroom, new and modern. The staff was helpful with all our questions, especially with dining recommendations. Without hesitation, we would recommend this hotel to any traveler to Venice. Our kids loved this hotel best.

Reviews.Title: “Not A 4 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jayajmera
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definately not 4 star, it is a boutique hotel alright but nothing else. Its like owning a ferrari with 4 kids. The hotel is nice but not practical. I think the star system in europe is not really true. This hotel is next to san marco square but the bed and bathroom is very small. The bed that they show you on the website, you are not going to get that. Remember this it only has 6 rooms, so if you dont like the room you are pretty much out of options. Pay more in venice and stay on the water it well worth it. Good luck I hope this review helps since I was not satisfied and would never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinkkatieb
Reviews.Content: Really great hotel. The owners are really friendly and nothing is too much trouble for them. The breakfast is great and the lady who makes coffee in the morning is a sweetheart. Our room was lovely - bed low to the floor in typical Moorish style. Really clean, thoughtful touches and quiet. There was a great lounge on the second floor where you could read/have drink from the honesty bar. Felt so relaxed there and would def recommend this highly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Novecento”
Reviews.Author: beisner
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel during the holiday period. The staff was very helpful suggesting restaurants. Bedrooms and baths are on the smaller side but very lovely and quite comfortable. Shower is nice and bedding comfortable. Only negative was that the internet was not working and we had wanted to stay only in hotels with internet access. Hot towel rack was also not working. Otherwise, breakfast and accommodations were great and the location perfect. An easy walk to all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very Memorable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: scubawiz
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked this hotel and our trip to Venice as a birthday surprise for me and our stay was for three nights. The staff at the Novecento hotel were unaware of our 'special occasion' but it certainly didn't feel that way. From the moment we checked-in to our check out they couldn't have done more. All the staff were great and the room was delightful. The breakfasts were more than adequate, very tasty and plenty of choice. If you are looking for a well located place to stay in the form of a boutique hotel then this has to be it. On the morning of our check out Venice was experiencing some of the worst rain storms in memory. We were running low on Euros and couldn't get to a bank in time to make our ferry crossing back to the airport. We were given some Euros so that we didn't need to worry about finding a bank and supplied with a couple of hotel umbrellas to keep us dry for our walk to the ferry pick up point. Would hope to return to Venice soon and certainly would recommend a stay here to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place”
Reviews.Author: LuxuryAdelaide
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with great staff and breakfast was good as well, we loved the place. It's a shame it's in Venice as we did not like Venice at all. If you have to go please in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: HavHun65
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. We started our honeymoon in Italy, in Venice and our first hotel was the Novacento. The hotel is a posh boutique hotel with beautiful, high-finish decor and lots of little extras. The location was great, in San Marco proper, but away from the madness. The hotel was peaceful and chilled out. The staff at the Novacento were friendly and super professional. They gave us good suggestions for tours and places to eat, helped us with onward connections and transport and were generally just pleasent, nice people. We loved our room (number 6) the large, 'louche' platform bed, crisp white linens, Morraccan-themed decor and delicate lighting made the room a romantic hideaway. The only little (little) ding would be that the bathroom shower leaked but it didn't affect or stay in anyway. We felt really spoilt there and it was the perfect start to our honeymoon. Excellent value and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: scolona
Reviews.Content: Very trendy, very spacious rooms, bathrooms, air conditioning, etc. Thought it was fantastic value for the money. Morrocan decor, very clean, great staff. Loved it! perfect location, close to San Marco square.

Reviews.Title: “A Romantic Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kittybug
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect of this hotel when I booked it but it turned out to be a really nice romantic hotel. I don't believe that the hotel has any canal views available but our room had a tiny balcony that overlooked a garden. The hotel is decorated in middle eastern/Asian antiques. The room was very clean and had down comforters and pillows which made for a very comfy night's rest. We had to take off early in the morning but I wish we could have stayed to have the complimentary breakfast in the hotel's garden patio.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Midoast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 3 nights this summer - and recommend it without qualification. The room was beautful - modern, with great taste. and immaculate... and the overall feel of the place was like a fine gem. And very importantly, it is on a very quiet side street, so we heard no noise at all, The owner and the other staff were warm and helpful in every way.. and all spoke perfect English. The location was great... free internet... and great breakfast. Overall, the Novecento is indeed, as in its ful name, an exceptional boutique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very Special”
Reviews.Author: BobbiSydney
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Novecento at the start of our Italian honeymoon and couldnt have chosen better. Its peaceful location was ideal as it was still close to all the main attractions. The staff make you feel very welcome and the breakfasts were wonderful, especially the lovely lady that looked after us. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: anam01
Reviews.Content: Excellent service on a very nice location, close to main atractions on San Marcos. Excellent breakfast and front desk service, nice rooms. Highly recomended. Ask how to get to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and exotic boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilykins1
Reviews.Content: The Novecento Hotel is a boutique hotel that offers a nice and quiet location in Venice but that's also close to all the action. The decor is well done and very exotic. There a oriental rugs draped over the floors, interestingly patterned fabrics everywhere and exotic scents wafting through the air. The staff was attentive yet discreet and they had champagne and chocolates waiting for us and were very pleasant even though we were very late checking in (2am)!! The breakfast offered was very good. Great coffee...of course! A very well run hotel!

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gedLondon
Reviews.Content: this is a charming hotel. the hotel blends tradition with modernity. beautiful original furniture with modern utilities. its also perfectly located, 10 min walk to st marks sq & accademia gallery, 20 to rialto. rooms are well sized and comfortable. we had a lovely time so would highly recommend it, my only small cristicism would be there is no view( just either the garden or the street outside) but you really wont care. novecento is perfect for a romatic weekend plus well priced for venice, which maybe the most fascinating city you will ever visit, but be warned.... incredibly expensive!!! gondola ride 100 euros for 30 mins, water taxi 100 euros from the airport. but in the end its all worth it, particularly the water taxi from the airport. they dropped us off literally a 100 yards from the hotel and boy is it fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: Sam25Nottingham
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfect stay in Venice. On arrival we were greeted by the very friendly owner who offered us a drink. We were a little early but just wanted to drop off our overnight bag so we could start exploring venice, of which they were more than happy to oblige. This hotel is perfectly placed within reach of Piazza San Marco and the Grand Canal. Especially the Water Taxi pick up and drop off point!. The rooms are of normal size and the bathroom is much more than we expected. Breakfast is lovely and can be taken in the small garden found at the back of the hotel. This hotel is small and freindly and is a welcome retreat from the bustling streets of tourist packed venice. I think next time (if there is one) we will stop in the sister hotel - Hotel Flora. This is closer to the Piazza San Marco and just looks a little bit more grander for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Maril511
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at this charming hotel. Small (9 rooms), intimate, and very friendly. Our room was large enough for 3 people--difficult to find in Venice. Decor was quite interesting--a mix of Venetian, art deco, and far eastern. Breakfast on the terrace was always lovely. Free internet access was a big plus for me. Given that Venice was extraordinarly hot, it was wonderful to have such powerful air conditioning. One small complaint. We could never get very hot water in the shower. The staff was always willing to book reservations and suggest restaurants. The hotel was only a short walk from the San Giglio vaporetto stop. Price was very fair, given that Venice is so expensive. I noticed a number of families staying here and the staff was always friendly to them. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Unique, quiet hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: travelnyc79
Reviews.Content: We LOVED Novacento. Of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, this had the most unique decour with African and Asian influences. We stayed 3 nights for our honeymoon and loved that it was more tucked away and quiet, away from all the tourists. You can turn on music in the rooms which is really nice and also there is 30 minutes free of internet every day in the lobby which is very convenient. The breakfast is wonderful and the staff is so helpful and extremely friendly in making reservations and suggesting restaurants. The last day, we had to leave pretty early-- the staff was kind enough to let us have breakfast early before we checked out. The shower feels like you are showering in a waterfall and the honesty bar is really nice in the hotel. We would definitely recommend Novacento to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gorgas1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 3 nights in late March and found it to be quite a little find. The location cannot be beat, staff very accomodating, nice quiet rooms and a great breakfast spread to get you started in the morning. Our room was nice, bed a tad hard, and for the most part had quiet nights. Caution if you are a light sleeper, you can be annoyed if you happen to have noisy, inconsiderate people rooming next to you but for the most part, the rooms are fairly soundproof. We really enjoyed our stay here and would for sure return and /or suggest this location to friends/family in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, intimate hotel without fault!”
Reviews.Author: Schmabbit
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Novecento a year ago and had chosen to stay there again this week and have to say that we cannot fault the hospitality and comfort. The staff are incredibly friendly without being intrusive, the hotel is positioned within 10 mins walk to St Marks square so is in a great location but is also located just off a very quiet square so you can escape the tourists if you need, which also made it very quiet at night and meant our 10 month old baby girl slept well. The staff are always happy to provide information regarding transportation , restaurant recommendations etc. We liked the copious breakfast and there is plenty of choice. Duvets on the beds are lovely rather than the usual hotel sheets and will not doubt keep you warm if visiting during the cold Venetian winter! Also the decoration of the hotel is in the style of Marco Polo/ Orient which is a welcome change to the usual Venetian decoration and adds a luxurious touch. It is also great value for money in what can be a very expensive city. We will definatly stay there again and again and again...........! GREAT!

HotelInfo.Name: Novecento Boutique Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Calle del Dose, 2684 | San Marco 30124, 30124 Venice, Italy
